abstract: The General Electric shoe-scanning machine, rejected by the government, was supposed to enable airline passengers to pass through security with their shoes on.
snippet: The General Electric shoe-scanning machine, rejected by the government, was supposed to enable airline passengers to pass through security with their shoes on.
lead_paragraph: You will still have to take your shoes off at the airport checkpoint. The Transportation Security Administration said yesterday that it had rejected the use of a General Electric shoe-scanning machine that was supposed to provide a central benefit for members of the Clear version of the Registered Traveler program: the ability to pass through security with their shoes on. The machine would instead have scanned the shoes electronically for weapons or explosives.

headline.main: U.S. Again Rejects a Shoe Scanner
headline.print_headline: U.S. Again Rejects A Shoe Scanner
